course_name: Narrative Medicine I: Witnessing, Listening, Reflecting
description: Introduction to Narrative Medicine and history of health humanities; examine theories of narrative, trauma, witnessing, identity as related to health care and the clinical encounter.

course_name: Creative Writing and Its Applications in Narrative Medicine
description: Introduction to creative writing in the clinical setting; study of nonfiction/journalism, memoir, fiction and poetry; work toward a creative project that incorporates narrative medicine methods.
Explore philosophical underpinnings of qualitative research and its use in health research; develop specific methodologies for data collection and assessment in Narrative Medicine.

course_name: Narrative Ethics: Illness, Disability, Equity and Community
description: Examine the relationship between illness and disability narratives and their familial, social and institutional contexts; develop skills in interviewing, close reading and writing toward publication.
